charts.name: Survey comparison heatmap
charts.description: Heatmap comparing survey methodology and scope across key papers in hedge fund fraud detection literature

charts.name: AUM growth timeline
charts.description: Timeline showing global hedge fund AUM growth from 2000 to 2024, highlighting major fraud events and regulatory milestones

charts.name: Fraud taxonomy difficulty ratings
charts.description: Visualization of fraud types (Ponzi, misrepresentation, NAV manipulation, etc.) with difficulty ratings for detection

charts.name: 4-layer data ecosystem
charts.description: Four-layer architecture diagram showing regulatory filings, news/media, market data, and alternative data sources

charts.name: US vs EU regulatory comparison
charts.description: Comparative table of US (SEC, CFTC, Form PF) and EU (AIFMD, ESMA) regulatory frameworks

charts.name: 5-stage pipeline flow
charts.description: Flowchart of the 5-stage detection pipeline: data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, inference, and explainability

charts.name: Feature families radar
charts.description: Radar chart showing 10 feature families: return patterns, volatility, autocorrelation, liquidity, style drift, operational risk, etc.

charts.name: Model-fraud type heatmap
charts.description: Heatmap showing which model families (logistic regression, random forest, XGBoost, neural nets, etc.) are best suited for each fraud type

charts.name: Method comparison bars
charts.description: Bar chart comparing performance (AUC, F1) of statistical, machine learning, and hybrid methods across studies

charts.name: Critical assessment radar
charts.description: Radar chart highlighting gaps in literature: limited public datasets, model interpretability, adversarial robustness, real-time detection

charts.name: Attack vectors diagram
charts.description: Diagram showing adversarial attack vectors: data poisoning, evasion attacks, model inversion, and defenses

charts.name: Readiness heatmap
charts.description: Heatmap assessing industry readiness for EU AI Act requirements: transparency, robustness, data governance, human oversight

charts.name: Explainability vs performance
charts.description: Scatter plot showing the tradeoff between model interpretability and detection performance (AUC) across model families

charts.name: Open problems by category
charts.description: Hierarchical map of open research problems grouped by category: data, methods, evaluation, deployment, ethics

charts.name: Impact vs feasibility scatter
charts.description: 2x2 matrix plotting open research problems by impact (y-axis) and feasibility (x-axis) to prioritize future work

charts.name: 3 contributions visual
charts.description: Visual summary of 3 key contributions: systematic literature review, detection pipeline framework, research agenda

charts.name: Audience takeaways matrix
charts.description: Matrix of key takeaways tailored for different audiences: regulators, fund managers, researchers, investors

charts.name: Literature screening funnel
charts.description: Funnel diagram showing literature search process: initial hits, after deduplication, after screening, final inclusion (105 papers)

charts.name: Database coverage bars
charts.description: Bar chart showing paper counts by database: SSRN, Web of Science, Scopus, IEEE Xplore, Google Scholar

charts.name: Boolean query structure
charts.description: Visual representation of the Boolean search query structure with fraud terms, hedge fund terms, and method terms

charts.name: Feature table by category
charts.description: Comprehensive table of all 10 feature families with mathematical definitions, interpretations, and fraud detection relevance
